sentence: So the tight ening cycle, as you know, is a re flection of the strength of the economy.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. The mention of a "tightening cycle" implies a move towards higher interest rates, indicating a more restrictive monetary policy. The reference to the strength of the economy reinforces this hawkish sentiment.

sentence: And it’ s almost three years now that we’ve been gradually raising rates.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy as it highlights the continuous increase in interest rates over a significant period of time. It implies that the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) has been adopting a more aggressive approach towards tightening monetary policy.

sentence: And I think the fact tha t we have moved quite gradually , in a way, allows us to carefully watch incoming data in the real economy and in the financial ma rkets to see how the economy is processing higher interest rat es.

sentence: And the fact that we’re movi ng so gradually—I think it—I think it limits the long and variable lags problem because, you know,  we’re being able to raise rates and then wait and see how the econo my absorbs these rate increa ses.
